page.title: 01Homes and home life
page.content: Some houses are part of the family farm holding, some are privately owned cottages and some are council houses. All the houses are surrounded by hedged fields and orchards; the children at school live either on a farm or next to one and are familiar with the seasonal variations and events from lambing time through the different harvests _ silage, hay, corn, fruit _ to the return of the migratory birds in winter. Tim: "I live on a farm. We have two farms. We live in a council house. It is big. We have about 200 acres on our farm. We grow corn and keep cows and calves." Martin: "In the morning I get up and get the cows in and put them in with the calves. Then I go and feed the bantams and give them some water, then I go back and let the cows back into
